en.purpose: To apply the Rome IV criteria for diagnosing NBS.
en.use: Use in patients presenting with chronic abdominal pain and a history of opioid use for ≥3 months.
en.misuse: Do not use for diagnosing opioid withdrawal syndrome.

gt0001.text: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Narcotic Bowel Syndrome (NBS)
gt0001.description: A clinical decision support guideline to diagnose NBS using Rome IV criteria. The guideline  is based on the criteria for centrally mediated abdominal pain syndrome

gt0021.text: Chronic or frequently recurring abdominal pain that is treated with acute high-dose or chronic narcotics.

gt0022.text: The nature and intensity of the pain is not explained by a current or previous GI diagnosis.

gt0023.text: The pain worsens or incompletely resolves with continued or escalating dosages of narcotics.

gt0024.text: There is marked worsening of pain when the narcotic dose wanes and improvement when narcotics are re-instituted (soar and crash).

gt0025.text: There is a progression of the frequency, duration, and intensity of pain episodes.

gt0026.description: Diagnostic result is positive, fulfill the criteria for NBS.
